data.title: Latest Verisign SSL Certificate Price List (2024)
data.meta_description: Find the latest Verisign SSL certificate prices and choose the best plan for your website security. Compare rates and features now!
data.text:
Verisign SSL certificates are a popular choice for securing websites. When considering the price list for Verisign SSL certificates, it’s important to understand the different types of certificates and their associated costs.

Here’s a detailed discussion of the steps involved in understanding the Verisign SSL certificate price list:

Understanding SSL Certificates

An SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) certificate is a digital certificate that authenticates the identity of a website and encrypts information sent to the server. Verisign offers a range of SSL certificates with varying features and prices.

Types of SSL Certificates

Verisign provides different types of SSL certificates, such as Domain Validation (DV), Organization Validation (OV), and Extended Validation (EV) certificates.

The level of validation and the features offered determine the price of each certificate.

Verisign SSL Certificate Price List (Norton Secured Seals)

Verisign, now known as Norton Secured Seals, offers a range of SSL certificates with varying prices depending on features and validation levels. Here’s a breakdown of their main options:

Domain Validation (DV) Certificates:

Secure Site: Starting at $399/year. Basic encryption for single domain.

Wildcard: Starting at $1,999/year. Secures multiple subdomains under a single domain.

Organization Validation (OV) Certificates:

Pro: Starting at $995/year. Enhances validation with business verification. Green address bar and company information display.

EV Pro: Starting at $1,499/year. Highest level of validation with extensive checks. Green address bar with padlock, company information, and dynamic site seal.

Additional factors that may affect price:

Number of years purchased: Multi-year plans typically offer discounts per year.

Add-ons: Additional features like malware scanning or vulnerability assessments can increase the cost.

Tips for choosing the right Verisign SSL certificate:

Consider your website’s needs: Do you need basic encryption or enhanced validation with business verification?

Think about your budget: How much can you afford to spend on an SSL certificate?

Compare features: Different certificates offer different features, so choose one that meets your specific needs.

Factors Affecting the Cost

The price of a Verisign SSL certificate, or any other brand for that matter, can be influenced by several factors. Here’s a breakdown of the key elements that can impact the cost:

Type of SSL Certificate:

Domain Validation (DV): These are the most basic and affordable, verifying domain ownership through email or DNS.

Organization Validation (OV): More thorough, requiring company documentation and phone verification.

Extended Validation (EV): The most rigorous, with in-depth identity verification displayed in a green address bar and company name.

Number of Domains Secured:

Single Domain: Covers only one domain name.

Multi-Domain: Secures multiple subdomains or additional domain names at a higher cost.

Wildcard: Protects an entire domain and all its subdomains, typically pricier than a single domain.

Validity Period:

Longer validity periods (3 years) usually cost more than shorter ones (1 year).

Additional Features:

Site seals, malware scanning, vulnerability assessments, PCI compliance checks can push the price up.

Provider and Brand:

Verisign, as a premium brand, generally has higher prices compared to budget-friendly providers.

Special offers and discounts can affect cost significantly, so compare different providers.

Other Considerations:

Support & Installation: Some providers offer managed services for installation and configuration, impacting the cost.

Renewal Fees: Check renewal fees, as some vendors increase them after the initial purchase.

Understanding these factors and make an informed decision when choosing a Verisign SSL certificate or any other brand, finding the best value for your security needs and budget.

Considerations for Purchase

When deciding on a Verisign SSL certificate, it’s essential to consider the specific security needs of your website.

For example, e-commerce sites handling sensitive customer data may require the additional validation and trust indicators provided by EV certificates, while personal blogs or small business websites may find DV certificates sufficient.

When purchasing a Verisign SSL certificate, choosing the right one amidst diverse options can be overwhelming. Here are some key considerations to navigate the process smoothly:

Your Website Needs:

Security Level: Assess your website’s sensitivity and data handling. Do you need basic encryption (DV) or advanced authentication (OV/EV)?

Number of Domains: Decide if you need a single domain certificate, multi-domain for subdomains, or a wildcard for an entire domain with subdomains.

Features: Consider additional features like malware scanning, website vulnerability assessments, or PCI compliance for specific industries.

Budget and Value:

Compare Prices: Don’t stick solely to Verisign, explore offerings from reputable, budget-friendly providers. Compare prices for different validation levels, domains, and validity periods.

Multi-Year Plans: Consider multi-year plans for significant discounts compared to annual renewals.

Renewal Costs: Look into renewal fees, some providers significantly increase them after the initial purchase.

Ease of Use and Support:

User Interface: Choose a provider with a user-friendly interface for certificate management, installation, and renewal.

Customer Support: Ensure the provider offers reliable customer support if you encounter any issues with your certificate.

Verisign Specific Considerations:

Reputation and Trust: Verisign boasts a high reputation with trusted certificates, but consider if the premium cost aligns with your website’s needs.

Green Address Bar: EV certificates from Verisign display a green address bar and company name, enhancing trust but at a higher price.

Additional Tips:

Read Reviews: Look for independent reviews of different providers and their SSL certificate offerings.

Check for Discounts and Promotions: Many providers offer seasonal or special discounts, keep an eye out for best deals.

Understand the Validation Process: Ensure you can provide necessary documentation for the chosen validation level (OV/EV).

Verisign 3-Pro Advantage

The VeriSign 3-Pro Advantage is a 3-in-1 security product that offers various features to enhance website security and credibility.

It includes the Daily Malware Scanner (DMS) to protect websites from blacklisting, Seal-in-Search for promoting credibility, and a browser add-on that populates on over 70 million desktops.

The product also aims to propel interactivity and revenue.

At the same time, the HP Pico Neo 3 Pro VR Headset is a virtual reality headset that offers improved accuracy and latency experience with the introduction of two new 6DoF controllers, room-scale tracking, ergonomic design, high-fidelity FOV, and built-in eye tracking.

The future of Verisign Inc.’s tech strategy may be influenced by various factors, including government mandates and the professional world.

How to get verisign certificate free

To obtain a free SSL certificate, you can use services such as ZeroSSL, which provides SSL certificates for free and allows for automated renewal.

ZeroSSL offers a quick verification process and a user-friendly dashboard for certificate management.

And some websites, such as Verisign, may offer free SSL trials, as mentioned in a Zimbra Tech Center article.

Note that the availability of free SSL certificates may be subject to change, so it’s advisable to check the latest information from the respective certificate providers.

Best Verisign SSL certificate Alternatives

As you’ve seen, Verisign is definitely a well-established name in the SSL certificate world, but there are plenty of excellent alternatives that might be a better fit for your needs and budget.

Here are some top contenders:

Premium Alternatives:

DigiCert: Arguably the new Verisign, DigiCert boasts a strong reputation for security, reliability, and excellent customer support. They offer a wide range of certificates, including high-assurance OV and EV options, at competitive prices.

Sectigo (formerly Comodo): Sectigo holds the largest market share of commercial CAs and offers affordable pricing with robust features like malware scanning and OCSP stapling. Their “SSL.com” brand caters to individuals and small businesses with simple, budget-friendly options.

Thawte: Now owned by DigiCert, Thawte certificates offer good value for money, particularly for organizations seeking OV validation. They’re known for their fast issuance times and user-friendly platform.

Budget-Friendly Alternatives:

Let’s Encrypt: If you’re on a tight budget, Let’s Encrypt offers free DV certificates that are just as secure as paid options. You’ll need to manage renewals manually, but they’re perfect for simple websites or non-critical applications.

SSL.com: As mentioned above, SSL.com by Sectigo provides affordable DV and OV certificates with quick issuance and basic customer support.

Namecheap: This domain registrar also offers a variety of SSL certificates at competitive prices, making them a good option for budget-conscious website owners.

Choosing the Right Alternative

The best Verisign alternative for you depends on your specific needs and priorities. Consider factors like:

Validation Level: DV (domain validation) is quick and cheap, but OV (organization validation) and EV (extended validation) offer increased trust and credibility.

Features: Some certificates include additional features like malware scanning, wildcards, and multi-domain support.

Price: Verisign is known for being on the pricier side, so you can likely find comparable security at a lower cost with another CA.

Customer Support: Consider the level of support you need and choose a CA with a good reputation for responsiveness and helpfulness.

Remember: Regardless of which CA you choose, ensure they are a reputable, vetted organization with a proven track record of security and reliability.

Wrap!

In conclusion, the price list for Verisign SSL certificates varies based on the type of certificate, the level of validation, and additional features. It’s important to assess your website’s security needs and consider these factors when evaluating the cost of Verisign SSL certificates.
